title: Economic and Social Data Service - Large Scale Government Surveys
abstractText:
The Economic and Social Data Service (ESDS) is a national data service providing access and support for an extensive range of key economic and social data, both quantitative and qualitative, spanning many disciplines and themes. ESDS â€“ Government is one of four specialist ESDS services and provides specialist support for the large-scale government surveys, such as the General Household Survey and the Labour Force Survey, which are key resources for analysis of demographic and socio-economic processes in the UK and its component countries.

ESDS Government is led by CCSR at the University of Manchester and provides user support, runs user meetings on specific surveys, runs training courses on key topics of interest, on specific statistical packages and on methods of statistical analysis and provides topic-related online course materials and a range of teaching datasets. The service aims to promote and facilitate increased and more effective use of government datasets in research, learning and teaching across a range of disciplines.

The UK Data Archive undertake the acquisition, processing and delivery of the large-scale government datasets and make data available via the web-based download system and, through NESSTAR, for online browsing and visualisation.
